main event: An airline pilot observed a rocket-like object during a flight on November 24, 1956.
interesting points: The object was directly across the flight path of the observer at 30 to 40 miles ahead., The observation lasted approximately five minutes., The estimated trajectory of the object suggested it would make contact with the ground east of Aberdeen., After the estimated time of contact, a fire was seen in the area for about ten minutes., The sighting was made while airborne in an Eastern Airlines Constellation.
witness description: Airline pilot for 20 years, Captain Jame Hackett
